[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The KeePass system defines requirements for secure credential storage, management, and encryption.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: KeePass enables password storage, retrieval, and organizational sharing with security controls.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: KeePass integrates with OS authentication, USB storage, and cloud plugins.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: KeePass provides graphical and command-line interfaces.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: Compatible with desktops, laptops, and encrypted USB devices.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: KeePass supports APIs and third-party plugin extensions.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: KeePass uses encrypted connections for synchronization and updates.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: KeePass is optimized for multitasking with secure in-memory operations.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: KeePass ensures 24/7 availability with minimal maintenance.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: Configurable for enterprise and individual security policies.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: KeePass integrates with cloud storage and multi-factor authentication.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: KeePass encrypts, organizes credentials, generates strong passwords, and supports plugins.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: Designed for individuals and enterprises with basic IT knowledge.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: KeePass depends on Master Password security and plugin compatibility.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: KeePass requires .NET/Mono frameworks and stable connectivity.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall integrate with USB devices for secure data portability.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall support third-party and proprietary plugins to extend encryption, backup, and authentication capabilities.

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall encrypt databases using AES 256-bit encryption (REQ-DSGN-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall allow users to manage credential categories such as passwords, SSH keys, and API tokens (REQ-DB-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-003: The system shall generate, store, and securely retrieve strong passwords.

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall provide an intuitive graphical interface for seamless management.
[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-002: The system shall allow secure password copying with automatic expiration timeouts.

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall load encrypted databases within 2 seconds.
[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-002: The system shall support 10,000 credential entries without retrieval delay.

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall securely store encrypted credentials with integrity checks.
[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-002: The database shall support role-based access, logging, and audit trails.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall comply with AES encryption standards.
[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-002: The system shall support a modular architecture for flexible plugin integration.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall adhere to ISO 27001 for credential security and comply with GPL licensing for open-source use.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall support Windows, macOS, and Linux with full cross-platform compatibility.
[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-002: The system shall log all security-critical events for compliance auditing.

[SEC] 3. Verification: Validates encryption, database functions, and compliance benchmarks.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: User manuals, security best practices, and enterprise deployment recommendations.
[SEC] 5. References: KeePass documentation, ISO 27001 guidelines, and GPL licensing requirements.
